comments:
Hello,

I?m trying to use JIDE docking framework with my eclipse proyects, and I have the next excepti?n everytime with the automatically generated code (by JIDE designer):

UIDefaults.getUI() failed: createUI() failed for com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame[key=Frame1,mode=DOCK,side=SOUTH] java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
java.lang.Error
	at javax.swing.UIDefaults.getUIError(Unknown Source)
	at javax.swing.MultiUIDefaults.getUIError(Unknown Source)
	at javax.swing.UIDefaults.getUI(Unknown Source)
	at javax.swing.UIManager.getUI(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.updateUI(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at Sample$1.create(Sample.java:59)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DefaultDockingManager.readFrameElement(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DefaultDockingManager.loadInitialLayout(Unknown Source)
	at Sample.load(Sample.java:65)
	at Sample.load(Sample.java:38)
	at Sample.main(Sample.java:130)
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.installMouseHandlers(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.updateUI(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DockableFrame.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at Sample$1.create(Sample.java:59)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DefaultDockingManager.readFrameElement(Unknown Source)
	at com.jidesoft.docking.DefaultDockingManager.loadInitialLayout(Unknown Source)
	at Sample.load(Sample.java:65)
	at Sample.load(Sample.java:38)
	at Sample.main(Sample.java:130)

I don?t understand the error, this code works in NetBeans without problems. And The JIDE company don?t have any report at this respect. 

I think you can help me to know what that exception means.

Thanks!!

it looks like javax.swing.UIManager.getUI() is returning null because UIDefaults.getUI() is throwing java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException.

What is the eclipse compiler set to for that project? 1.4? 5.0?  What version of java is running eclipse?  What libraries are you using (Window>Preferences>Java>Installed JREs)?

Are you running from within eclipse when this happens?

Please REOPEN with this information.

PW

Hello, 

I?ve been asking to the JIDE company too, and they told me to check the code under their example package (with the configuration they made) and it works. But I don?t know the reason that it didn?t work before, because I didn?t make any change in the original code generated by visual designer and the compilation was without errors. If I find some reasons i?ll write it to you.

Thanks for your interest.

I was working with eclipse calisto, and Java 1.5.0_07, but the reasson seemed to be the package configuration.

Hello, 

I?ve been asking to the JIDE company too, and they told me to check the code under their example package (with the configuration they made) and it works. But I don?t know the reason that it didn?t work before, because I didn?t make any change in the original code generated by visual designer and the compilation was without errors. If I find some reasons i?ll write it to you.

Thanks for your interest

I was working with calipso under JRE 1.5.0_07 but i think the reason it didn?t work was the package configuration.
I mark the bug as closed
